quest.name: Lurkers in the Grotto
journal: Staelwyrn, the owner of Summerford Farms, has a task for a competent adventurer.

The farmhands report that a gang of savage-looking men with tattooed faces has been loitering in the vicinity of the farm, watching. The farmhands believe the unwelcome visitors to be the rumored kidnappers, and the resulting atmosphere of unease has taken a considerable toll on the farm's productivity. Make your way to Seasong Grotto, and investigate the area reported to be the tattooed thugs' den.
At Seasong Grotto, your encounter with a woman bearing a strange contraption is suddenly interrupted by the charge of an enraged goobbue.

After discovering a seafarer's knife lodged in the defeated creature's back, the woman seems convinced that the perpetrators of the kidnappings are pirates. Return to Summerford Farms and present your findings to Staelwyrn.

Staelwyrn assures you that the lady you encountered at the grotto is unconnected with the abductions, and concurs with her theory concerning the likely involvement of pirates. After thanking you for your part in the investigation, the farmer bids you to continue helping those in need for the good of Limsa Lominsa.
objectives: Deliver the blunt sailor's knife to Staelwyrn at Summerford Farms.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Ah, Surname. That aura of confidence tells me you've not been idle since last we met.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: I hope I've read you aright, for I've a task that requires the attention of a capable adventurer. Might that adventurer be you?

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Good to hear. Then I shall lay before you the sorry tale.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: You will have heard rumors of the abductions. Aye, citizens have been disappearin' from every corner of Limsa Lominsa, as if plucked from the face of Hydaelyn, boots and all, by an unseen hand.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: And what's this got to do with Summerford Farms, you might ask. Well, that remains to be seen, but it seems a collection of right unsavory fellows with azure-tattooed faces has been creepin' up to the edges of the fields and spyin' on my yeomen.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Now, I doubt anyone would enjoy bein' scrutinized by such savages at the best of times, but the farmhands are convinced that they're the kidnappers of rumor, come for their hides.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Needless to say, they're beside 'emselves with worry, and their work's sufferin' for it─which is the very last thing I need when my old crewmen are still gettin' used to their new jobs. 'Tis a struggle to get 'em to leave the farmhouse of a mornin'.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: That is, as they say, where you come in. Would you be willin' to investigate these tattooed thugs for me?

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Good lasslad. The sooner we get to the bottom of this, the sooner this place will start to resemble a workin' farm again.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: I suggest you begin by havin' a look around Seasong Grotto. If reports are to be believed, our unwelcome visitors have occupied the place.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Be careful, though, Surname─I couldn't say for sure what manner of miscreants we're dealin' with here. If they are the kidnappers...well, just be on your guard, all right?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You are about to enter an instanced battle. Instanced battles only occur during certain quests and missions.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Take a moment to read the information displayed in the active help window before answering the call of duty.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Lurkers in the Grotto”?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
(-???-)I am the waves that bear.
I am the winds that guide.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
(-???-)I am the evening stars.
I am the morning sky.
I am born of the sea.
And there shall I die.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Thus reads the Sailors' Requiem carved into yonder stone.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Such words well describe the manner in which the citizens of Limsa Lominsa live their lives.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)It is both a litany against misfortune for those out on the waves...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)...and a prayer that the souls of those who perish on land might find their way back to the sea.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)We meet again.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Or do we? My apologies, I fear I have mistaken you for another.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Something about you... Your gait, perhaps? Well, no matter.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)What brings you to this sacred place of seafarers, if I may ask?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Ah, you are the adventurer I've seen around Summerford Farms.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)I thought myself on the trail of the kidnappers, but it would seem I have missed my mark.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)...Or perhaps not.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)As I suspected, the aetheric disturbance here is no natural occurrence.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Nor is it a coincidence that the two of us should come here in search of those responsible for the disappearances only to be attacked.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)But who stands to benefit from the keeping of this secret?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Such thoughts must wait. Let us attend to the task at hand, unpleasant though it be.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the frenzied creatures!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I sense something awry with this creature. Be on your guard.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Ware! The disruption of the aether draws others to the fray!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
Keep your focus on the battle!
Leave the tending of wounds to me.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
More unwelcome visitors?
Slay them quickly lest we be overwhelmed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
The creature falters.
Press the attack and the battle will soon be won.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Mayhap we are overmatched...

dialogue.name: MOTHERCRYSTAL
dialogue.text: Hear... Feel... Think...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Awake again, are we?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Aha. The poor creature's fury was kindled with cruel forethought.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)See this blade? I found it in the goobbue's back.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)I have seen knives of this kind before─they are most commonly used for the cutting of rope.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)It would appear our culprits are seafaring men of some persuasion...piratical being the most probable.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)In any event, you seem much recovered from your sudden...affliction.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)I confess, I was rather taken aback when you collapsed at the very moment of our victory. Mayhap a surfeit of aether...?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)I beg your pardon? A “towering crystal”? I'm sure I don't─ Oh.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)Well, well... This has been a day of unexpected revelations.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)I must continue my investigation.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)In the meantime, I suggest you deliver this knife to your patron, along with a warning concerning the pirates' probable involvement in this murky business.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)The days ahead promise little rest, I fear...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: (-Cultured Conjurer-)May our paths cross again under the light of the Crystal.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Surname! Right glad am I to see you safely returned!

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: My lads were all gabbin' about hearin' what sounded like all seven hells breakin' loose near the grotto, and I feared I'd sent you to your death.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: If you were in the middle of that commotion, I hope it yielded somethin' of interest. I'd hate to think you'd risked your life for naught.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... A blade pulled from the back of a creature you slew at the cave, eh?

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Aye, I'd agree that such a knife would be part of any seafarin' man's kit.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: I'm startin' to think that these ruffians are pirates, come to lure my farmhands back to a life of plunder. Chances are, they didn't take kindly to your appearance on their doorstep, and set a maddened goobbue on you.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Aye, the pirates have been addin' to their numbers of late. I'd best warn the lads and lasses in my employ to be on guard against their schemes.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: ...Hm? You met someone else at the grotto? A woman with a strange contraption...? Ah...Y'shtola!

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: She's been in Limsa Lominsa for a good while now. Her studies of the aether often bring her out to Summerford, so her presence at the grotto is hardly unusual.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: She's an odd-lookin' lass, I grant you, but she's not the kind to associate with kidnappers. You may take my word for that.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Where trust should be lackin' is in those yeomen of mine who have yet to wholly relinquish their pirate pasts. The temptation to return to the free and easy life of a buccaneer may prove too strong to resist.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: You have my thanks, Surname. If it weren't for the efforts of stalwart adventurers like yourself, this farm would be in a far worse state than it is.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Just you keep on lendin' your talents to those in need, eh? Help bring Limsa the brighter future she deserves.
